title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: On the 23d of February, he received aletter from Captain Shee of Fitz-James's dragoons,acquainting him that he made part of an armament commanded by the Marquis de Fimarion; thathe had landed with a part of the above regiment;that the rest of the squadron conveyed about eighthundred men, and that each of the ships broughta certain sum of money.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The Dukeof Cumberland, moving with all his forces, had arrived at Aberdeen on the 27th; and Moir ofStonywood, who commanded there for the Prince,was compelled to retreat to Fochabers, where he,and Captain Shee who accompanied him, met withLord John Drummond, who had advanced so farto protect the disembarkation.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Captain Shee, having appeared off Peterhead, hadlanded two thousand louis-d'or for his service, buthad declined to land the soldiers who were onboard, without an order from the Marquis D'-EguiUes, called the ambassador of France.
